p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from Mount Alexander mail, 13 May 1896, p. 2. The item is dated to 11 May 1896 as the last probable date for the request included in it to be effected.

p.seg: [Early yesterday morning Miss Bessie Halford, second daughter of the late William Halford, J.P., was united at "Avonsleigh"

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: in marriage to Mr Henry John King, of Collins-street, Melbourne. … Mr Arthur H. Hasell, the hon. secretary of the Melbourne Liedertafel, of which society Mr King is the conductor, attended the ceremony in a representative capacity, while Baron Sir F. Von Mueller, who regretted his inability to leave the city, telegraphed to the Curator of the local gardens requesting that Mr Doran would forward a suitable floral tribute to the bride in his name. …]
